intro: Capurodendron rufescens, commonly known as the red-barked tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its smooth, reddish-barked trunk and dense, evergreen foliage. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round fruits. Capurodendron rufescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
